direction.raw_text: Your father's right, Elaine.  You and I will make a darned good team. Ben swings the car around in a U-turn and speeds off in the other direction. 225

direction.raw_text: . 6 - TO BERKELEY - NIGHT (BECOMING DAY)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ben driving rapidly (left to right) past the landmarks established on the previous drive to Berkeley.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We have two Carl Smiths.  Is it Carl with a "C" or a "K"?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm afraid I don't know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Karl Smith with a "K" teaches History of Advertising -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And the other?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The one with the "C", Carl Smith Junior, is in our medical school. He lives at Gamma Delta Tau. 226
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ben pulls up in front of the Gamma Delta Tau house.  He gets out of the car.  He is haggard, tired and unshaven.  The car is mud-spattered. 227
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ben enters the hall.  Through a door can be seen a DOZEN OR SO FRATERNITY BROTHERS seated at a table chowing down. It is breakfast.  Ben walks into the dining room. 228
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The fraternity brothers are eating and talking noisily.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Say - fellows - They stop eating and turn toward him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do any of you fellows know where Carl Smith is?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He took off in the middle of the night to get married. He goes back to his breakfast.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Proabaly one step ahead of the shotgun.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you happen to know where he's getting married?  I'm supposed to be there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why don't you ask Carter?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Would you happen to know where I might find him?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's probably still in the sack. He's always in the sack. They start to laugh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Or in the can. They all laugh a great deal.  Ben gives a polite smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A large steam-filled room with a row of FRATERNITY BROTHERS in front of a row of sinks, brushing, combing, shaving, etc.  Ben is standing at the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, Carter - where's the Make Out King getting married?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Santa Barbara.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't happen to know exactly where the Make Out King is getting married, do you?  I'm supposed to be there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know.  Maybe at his old man's home.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You going to the wedding?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Give the bride a message for me. Tell her to act surprised. A great deal of laughter follows this gem.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (calling in the direc- tion of Carter's voice)
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . 1 TO SANTA BARBARA - DAY Ben driving (right to left).  The laughter from the previous scene can still be heard for a moment. Ben is exhausted-looking.  He opens the windows, turns the radio on and rubs his eyes. 231
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The car, moving speedily (right to left) south on the Highway to Santa Barbara. 232
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: the CAR leaving the freeway under a SANTA BARBARA sign. The car swings onto an off ramp and down to a street, turns into a gas station and stops near the office.  Ben gets out of the car and runs into the office. 233
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The clock on the office wall reads 2:05.  The gas station
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is sitting reading a stock car magazine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you have a phone? The attendant points.  Ben reaches for the phone book hanging under the pay phone. 234
direction.name: direction

result.heading: BRINGING PHONE BOOK UP INTO FOCUS

direction.raw_text: - BRINGING PHONE BOOK UP INTO FOCUS The front of it says SANTA BARBARA TELEPHONE DIRECTORY. Ben opens it to the S's.  His finger runs down to the Smiths.  There is at least a half a page of them. 235
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - THE PAGE Ben's finger runs up and down and stops at the name: Smith, Carl W., M.D. 236
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - BEN He inserts a dime and dials.  The attendant watches him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: of BUZZING from the phone.  It CLICKS open. 237
direction.name: direction

result.heading: TIGHT ON BEN WOMAN'S VOICE 657-2036 BEN

direction.raw_text: - TIGHT ON BEN WOMAN'S VOICE 657-2036 BEN Hello - who is this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is Dr. Smith's answering service.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is the doctor anywhere?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well - you see - the doctor is at his son's wedding, but I'm sure it's over by now.  He should be checking in any moment -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Listen to me.  I am Dr. Smith's brother - Reverend Smith - and I am supposed to perform the ceremony. I just got in - from - Portland - and I've forgotten what church - you see? 238
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - THE ATTENDANT The attendant puts down his magazine and stares. 239
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - TIGHT ON BEN WOMAN'S VOICE Oh.  Well - I'm not sure - but you might try the First Presbyterian. That's on Allan Street.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I certainly hope you - 240
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - BEN Ben hangs up the phone.  He turns to the attendant.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Allan Street.  Where is it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Six blocks up - three blocks over. Ben runs out of the office.  The attendant goes to the door. 241
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: DAY - SHOT OF BEN getting into car.  The attendant is in the b.g.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You need any gas, Father?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not a priest - I'm a minister. The car drives out of the station. 242
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The car comes toward us through the traffic.  It stops in the intersection to make the turn. 243
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - INT. CAR SOUND:  THE ENGINE FAILING.  Ben looks down. 244
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - THE GAS GAUGE The needle is on "E". 245
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - BEN He pumps the gas pedal. 246
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - THE CAR It makes the turn and rolls to a stop by the curb. 147
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - BEN He jumps out of the car, leaving the door open, and starts to run down the street. 248
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He looks up ahead on the other side of the street. 249
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The First Presbyterian Church. 250
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (2:15 PM) - SHOT OF BEN Running across the street.  He stops for a moment and looks around.  There are a number of cars parked in front of the church.  Among them is Mrs. Robinson's car.  Ben runs by it and up the steps to the front doors of the church. 251
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: DAY - SHOT OF BEN He pulls at the doors.  They are locked.  Through the glass doors, we can see to the front of the church where the wedding ceremony is taking place. 252
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: DAY - SHOT OF BEN running around the side of the church.  There are glass windows and doors through which, as he runs, we can see the ceremony continuing. 253
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ben runs, looking for an entrance.  He goes all the way around the church and stops at a side door.  He opens the door and goes in. 254
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The balcony is between two huge windows, one of which looks out on the lawn outside, the other looks into the interior of the church where the ceremony is taking place.  The sun is coming through the window.  Ben stops and looks through the inside window.  The minister is just closing the book. He says something and Carl and Elaine kiss.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, Jesus - God - no - He puts his hands up against the glass and slumps.  The minister shakes hands with Carl, then takes Elaine's hand. The ORGAN music starts to THUNDER.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No! He moves to the center of the window and begins to POUND on the glass.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Elaine - Elaine! Ben's shadow is thrown across the celebrants.  They all turn around and look up at him. 256
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: DAY - SHOT FROM FRONT OF CHURCH Ben is like a trapped moth, beating on the window and yelling soundlessly. 257
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - MRS. ROBINSON She looks up at Ben with a small, triumphant smile. 258
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - MR. ROBINSON looking up at Ben. 259
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - CARL looking up at Ben. 260
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - ELAINE looking up at Ben.  She moves down the aisle toward him, dazed. 261
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - ALL OF THEM Mr. Robinson, Carl, and Mrs. Robinson are moving toward Elaine.  The ORGAN is playing LOUDLY.  Ben's voice can be heard SHOUTING Elaine's name.  The POUNDING on the glass can be heard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who is that guy?  What's he doing?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll take care of him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's too late. The other guests are adlibbing their confusion. 262
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - ELAINE She turns back toward her mother, father and Carl as they come toward her. 263
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: looking at them.  ALL SOUND STOPS, except for Ben's voice in the distance shouting "ELAIN ELAINE ELAINE." 264
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Frozen frame. 265
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ROBINSON Frozen frame. 266
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ROBINSON Frozen frame. 267
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - ELAINE Her face turning quickly to look up at Ben. 268
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Frozen frame.  His face twisted with passion, his body spread-eagled against the glass. 269
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: looking up at Ben.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ben! The SOUND of the ORGAN and the guests' VOICES starts again. 270
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: DAY - SHOT - BEN He starts to go back down the stairs.  He reaches the bottom of the stairs and goes through a door which leads into the vestibule of the church. 271
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Robinson is waiting for Ben, crouching, his arms spread. Behind him is Elaine.  Ben moves toward them.  Mr. Robinson grabs Ben around the waist.  Ben twists away.  Mr. Robinson grabs Ben's collar and tears his jacket half off.  Ben turns and hits Mr. Robinson in the face.  Mr. Robinson falls down.  Ben moves to Elaine and grabs her hand.  He pulls her toward the doors.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on - don't faint. 272
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - THE ORGANIST His back to the action, clawing away at the organ obliviously. 273
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - THE DOOR A man in clerical garb is guarding the door.  Ben and Elaine move toward the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Out of my way! Carl steps in and grabs Ben from behind.  Ben breaks Carl's hold and picks up a gold cross off a nearby stand. He begins to swing it, advancing toward Carl.  Carl backs up toward the other guests. 274
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mrs. Robinson steps to Elaine.  She reaches out and takes Elaine's wrist.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Elaine - it's too late. Elaine pulls her hand away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not for me. 275
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He turns toward the man standing in front of the door and raises the cross over his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! The man moves away from the door.  Elaine steps forward and opens the door.  She and Ben go out. 276
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ben jams the cross through the handles of the door.  He grabs Elaine's wrist.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Run, Elaine, run! They start to run.  Elaine trips and falls.  Ben helps her up and they continue to run. 277
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: From inside the church vestibule.  Through the glass doors, we can see Elaine and Ben running down the street. The wedding party members are tugging furiously at the jammed doors.  Mrs. Robinson turns toward us and calmly begins to put on her gloves. 278
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ben and Elaine running along the sidewalk.  Ben holds her hand and is pulling her.  She still holds her flowers.  They run to a bus that is just closing its doors. 279
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - BEN He bangs on the closed door of the bus.  The door opens. Ben climbs the step into the bus and pulls Elaine up after him.  The doors close. 280
direction.name: direction

result.heading: SHOT OF BEN, ELAINE AND DRIVER

direction.raw_text: . 2 - DAY - SHOT OF BEN, ELAINE AND DRIVER Ben holds out a dollar bill.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How much?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where do you want to go?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To the end. The driver takes the bill and gives Ben some change. Ben turns and pulls Elaine along to the back of the bus. He pushes her into one of the seats and sits beside her.  Ben looks toward the front of the bus. 281
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He sees the driver and the passengers, all turned around in their seats and looking back at them. 282
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - BEN BEN Let's go.  Let's get this bus moving! 283
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - THE DRIVER He turns and starts the bus. 284
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - BEN AND ELAINE They are breathing heavily.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Benjamin?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What? She takes his hand. 285
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Through the window in the back of the bus the church can be seen receding in the distance.  There seem to be a number of men dressed in black running around in the street in front of it.
direction.name: direction
